intro: Gaumerocassia andrieuxii, commonly known as the Andrieux's cassia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. It produces pods that contain seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
